extendedIngredients.name: crimini mushrooms
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1-8 ounce container crimini mushrooms, thinly sliced (stems removed)

extendedIngredients.name: swiss chard
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunches Swiss chard, thick center ribs and stems removed, leaves coarsely chopped (about 6 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: lightly oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons lightly flavored oil (pecan, grape seed or olive oil)

recipes.title: Creamy Swiss Chard, Kamut and Egg Bake Casserole
recipes.instructions: If you've not cooked the Kamut already, please do so using this recipe as a guide. This should be completed before you start any remaining steps listed below.Preheat oven to 400 °F. Over medium high heat in a pot or large skillet, heat the oil. Add onion, salt and pepper. Cook for about 3 minutes until onion is wilted a bit.Add the mushrooms and stir well. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until mushrooms are softened and shiny.Next add the cooked Kamut and stir well to combine. Then add the chard, a little at a time stirring after each addition. Finally stir in the heavy cream.Simmer the mixture for 10-12 minutes until liquid from cream mostly evaporates. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking and to ensure even cooking. Turn off heat and stir in the parmesan cheese.Spread chard mixture evenly in a 9.5x6x1-inch (or similar sized) baking dish. Use a large spoon to make 6 small, evenly spaced holes in the chard mixture. Crack 1 egg into each hole. Season eggs with just a little salt and pepper.Place dish in the center of the oven and bake, rotating dish once, until egg whites set and yolks are still runny, about 15 minutes. Allow the dish to set for 5 minutes before serving.

steps.step: If you've not cooked the Kamut already, please do so using this recipe as a guide. This should be completed before you start any remaining steps listed below.Preheat oven to 400 °F. Over medium high heat in a pot or large skillet, heat the oil.
Add onion, salt and pepper. Cook for about 3 minutes until onion is wilted a bit.

Add the mushrooms and stir well. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, until mushrooms are softened and shiny.Next add the cooked Kamut and stir well to combine. Then add the chard, a little at a time stirring after each addition. Finally stir in the heavy cream.Simmer the mixture for 10-12 minutes until liquid from cream mostly evaporates. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking and to ensure even cooking. Turn off heat and stir in the parmesan cheese.

Spread chard mixture evenly in a 9.5x6x1-inch (or similar sized) baking dish. Use a large spoon to make 6 small, evenly spaced holes in the chard mixture. Crack 1 egg into each hole. Season eggs with just a little salt and pepper.
Place dish in the center of the oven and bake, rotating dish once, until egg whites set and yolks are still runny, about 15 minutes. Allow the dish to set for 5 minutes before serving.
